Reviews.Content: Terrific Hotel in Great Location This is a great budget hotel in Tokyo. Very close to Ueno station which gets you anywhere in the city and also to the Yanaka district - historic and a taste of everyday Tokyo.We had no problems finding the hotel, even though we had just arrived in Tokyo for our first visit after an overnight flight from Oz. They held our luggage for the day. The staff were very helpful and mad our stay very easy.Plenty of good food options close by and in Ueno station.Rooms were clean and well maintained.Enjoyed it so much that we returned for the last part of our trip.
Reviews.Author: old55Victoria

Reviews.Content: Great value  Easy Walking distance from JR Ueno Station and the Ameyacho outdoor markets. Small but adequate, clean and par for the price Y8000 for a double. Real bed, A/C, small bathroom but has all you need: shower, bath, modern toilet in room. They'll hold your luggage for you even if you're not staying there that day. Take the overpass from JR Station go down the escalator turn right before Lawsons.A little seedy at night, (one homeless person in a doorway on the way to Ameyacho) but still safe to go in pairs.English speaking front desk very helpful with directions and questions.
Reviews.Author: Traversed

Reviews.Content: Great Little Hotel Tokyo We stayed at this hotel in Ueno Tokyo from 19 March 2008 -25 March 2008,and found this to be a fabulous family run albeit small hotel right near the giant Ueno station(2 mins walk).If you want the 'Ritz' dont bother but if you want value for money,clean very centrally located and friendly service I highly recommend it. Yes its old and to do with a paint job but it is so conveniently located we would definately stay here if we ever came back to Tokyo.We paid less than AUD$100 per night and our first room was really small as are alot of Japanese rooms but when we asked for something larger.for an extra $125 for the week we got a huge room with 2 king singles a lounge and separate bathroom,very spacious and quiet.
Reviews.Author: koolkat-7

Reviews.Content: Excellent location and wonderful tourist hotel       Touganeya hotel lobby
Reviews.Author: trekkari

Reviews.Content: 7 nights a very cheap and good hotel. location is the best. the only problem is bringing 6 big luggages from the subway to ground floor. very near JR line and ueno station. the most convenient place, safe and clean. good friendly hotel staff. One english speaking, he is most willing to help even after his working hours. We stayed here for seven nights and didnt want to change to any other hotels due to the convenient location. My husband and I and our 5 children was happy staying in this hotel. Most recommended.
Reviews.Author: trippleSingapore

Reviews.Content: Great little place This is a great little place for the money. It is right off the JR Ueno stop. It is a small room, a bed and a little table, but you get your own bathroom and who spends that much time in their room anyways. The location is excellent and being in a busy spot the hotel is very quiet. The staff is also very helpful! I would definitely stay here again if I go back to Tokyo.
Reviews.Author: julie1217

Reviews.Content: Excellent Value This is a perfect budget hotel to stay in when visiting Tokyo. We stayed in early April 07 when arriving in Japan and again in late April before leaving. The room was tiny, but was clean and has everything you need. The location right near Ueno station is excellent - close to Ueno park and museums, a nice walk to Asakusa district, and very near the bustling markets of Ameyoko-cho. It was surprisingly quiet at night, so we slept well. Our room rate included japanese breakfast (rice and fish), which we thoroughly enjoyed. The small restaurant has the feel of old Japan - just like you'd imagine from old samurai movies. The hot fish is cooked up by a little old lady whose enthusiastic ohaiyo-gozaimas ! made a great start to the day. Plus there is free internet and English newspaper in the lobby so you can keep up with the news or check email. There is a laundry room at reasonable cost. My wife and I were well satisfied with our experience and would stay there again.- Red Deer, Alberta
Reviews.Author: SlowPilgrim

Reviews.Content: The Touganeya is everything you need My husband and I love this little hotel. It is unbelievably close to Ueno station. The staff is wonderfully helpful, and not too bad in the English department either. I needed to find a friend's restaurant in Ginza one night. The staff spent a good 45 minutes helping me find it on a map and then gave me perfect directions. The double rooms are tiny, it's true. But they're cosy and have everything you need. And the Japanese breakfast is fantastic. It's cooked every morning in the yakitori restaurant by a woman who seemed like our Japanese mother. Every morning we had the freshest fish, rice, tea, salad, beans, vegetables, and tofu, followed by a cup of American coffee and a warm smile. I would absolutely recommend this hotel.
Reviews.Author: sweethawk

Reviews.Content: Another Great Little Japanese Hotel We stayed at the Touganeya Hotel on our last night back from a 3-week train trek throughout Japan. Similar to most hotels in Japan, the room was efficient - small and clean. The front desk was friendly and helped us stow 4 pieces of luggage while we went out to do some last minute souvenir shopping after check-out. Getting to the hotel from the train station took about 10 mins towing some luggage and and needing to ask directions. The location of the hotel feels a little like it's in a back alley, but this is Tokyo and it was very safe.Great place to stay at a great price. Highly recommended!
Reviews.Author: Modena313

Reviews.Content: Stay at Touganeya Hotel, Tokyo. Clean and cheap.3 mins to subway. food easy around the corner and in subway.UENO stn is just 15 mins away via subway to city centre eg.Tokyo city ctr, Shinjuku and Ginza.If u r a budget traveller, stay either in UENO or Asakusa. Asakusa is 1 station away from UENO station, just 5 mins, where food is great and cheap and thats where u get souvenirs from their hundreds of shops and its a touristy district. From the hotel, u cld walk to Keisei subway (5mins) tat's where u will get dwn from Narita airport, there is a Tourist Info.Counter very convenient. Oh,When u arrived at Narita airport, go to the 2nd floor basement, get your 2or3 days metro subway pass, discounted rate.plan it carefully before u leave the airport as this save a lot compare to buying tickets all the time each time u go to one place to anthr.This cheap pass cld only get from the airport.I was tired of Japanese food on my 3rd day, thank God, there is a little chinese rest.arnd the corner from the hotel,gd food. if u want English breakie, go to subway in UENO/TOKYO/SHINJUKU.Thy even have hardrock cafe in UENO stn.Went Disneyland n Disneysea. DisneySea is much better to me. The rides are more for adults,amazing!Yes, from UENO, u cld go disneyland, jst change subway in it..Just go with a travel map of Japan from the hotel.U will not get lost on yr own.Just go to ticket counter in the subway to ask for the correct route if u r not sure, not all speak english,but,they were helpful.Japanese restaurant comes with pre-paid machine. dun worry, just select the food u want (with picture for ref).,n pay via the machine. Winter was a bit cold for me but bearable.Overall, it was a gd holiday.Also went Mt.Fuji(Hakone),emm..it was drizzling that day, so didnt see much, just took the Lake Ashi cruise.Wasted.
Reviews.Author: Megan-1808

Reviews.Content: Nice Little Hotel in Heart of Ueno               More photos
Reviews.Author: kang_a_ji
